results.abstract: Kenyan security forces are expected to head to Haiti for a year to combat gang violence that has killed thousands and forced many more people to flee widespread murders, kidnappings and extortion.

results.title: Tim Wakefield, Pitcher Who Helped Boston Break the Curse, Dies at 57

results.title: Why the ‘Mother of the Atomic Bomb’ Never Won a Nobel Prize
results.abstract: Lise Meitner developed the theory of nuclear fission, the process that enabled the atomic bomb. But her identity — Jewish and a woman — barred her from sharing credit for the discovery, newly translated letters show.

media.caption: Lise Meitner, the Austrian-born physicist, was a longtime collaborator of Otto Hahn, who won the Nobel Prize in 1946. She did not share in the award with him.
